sentence.Network_en: He hurries down the gangplank to hug his waiting wife.
sentence.Network_cn: 他匆匆忙忙走下跳板,张开双臂去拥抱他那等待着的妻子.

sentence.Network_en: The passengers stepped down gingerly from the narrow gangplank.
sentence.Network_cn: 乘客们战战兢兢地从狭窄的跳板上走下船来.

sentence.Network_en: She wept when he ran down the gangplank; sobbed as he stood on the dock, waving.
sentence.Network_cn: 他急步走下跳板,她哭个不停.他站在码头上挥手, 她还在呜咽.

when I got to the pier Mona was not to be seen . I waited for the last passenger to descend the gangplank , but no Mona .我赶到码头上却不见莫娜，等到最后一名乘客从跳板上下来仍没有莫娜。

entry.def: The gangplank is a short bridge or platform that can be placed between the side of a ship or boat and the shore, so that people can get on or off.

means.word_mean: 1. a temporary bridge for getting on and off a vessel at dockside

auth_sentence.content: One by one, we crawl awkwardly over the makeshift gangplank.
